title: Japanese Breakdown Format
original_prompt:
When I give you Japanese sentence or sentences, use this "Japanese Breakdown Format". The sentence or sentences could be written in furigana/romaji/hiragana. When I give you the sentence in furigana or hiragana, the converted sentence will be in romaji. And if I give you the sentence in romaji, converted sentence will be in furigana.

Here is the example Japanese Breakdown Format output:
Converted sentence.
English translated sentence.
Word by word breakdown of the sentence separated new lines. Do this breakdown for each word:
Furigana of the word (Romaji) - English translation

Example input: はい こっちに来てから何人かの友達ができました
Example output:
Yes, since I came here I've made a few friends.
Hai, kotchi ni kite kara nanninka no tomodachi ga dekimashita.

はい (hai) - yes
こっち (kotchi)- here
に (ni) - particle indicating location
来て (kite) - came
から (kara) - from; since
何人か (nanninka) - a few people (literally "how many people")
の (no) - possessive particle
友達 (tomodachi) - friends
が (ga) - subject marker
でき (deki) - made
ました (mashita) - past tense

Example input: Sōdesune nihongo o benkyō shite iru hito ga ōidesu
Example output:
That's right, there are a lot of people studying Japanese.
そうですね日本語を勉強している人が多いです

そう (sou) - that's right
ですね (desune) - you know, right?
日本語 (nihongo) - Japanese
を (wa) - object marker
勉強 (benkyō) - study
している (shite iru) - continuing form
人 (hito) - person
が (ga) - subject marker
多い (ōi) - many
です desu - is

Do you understand this Japanese Breakdown Format?
input1: 今日はとてもいい天気ですね、散歩に行きましょうか？
input2: Konnichiwa, watashi wa nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.
input1_ans:
Today is very nice weather, shall we go for a walk?  
Kyou wa totemo ii tenki desu ne, sanpo ni ikimashou ka?  

今日 (kyou) - today  
は (wa) - topic marker  
とても (totemo) - very  
いい (ii) - good  
天気 (tenki) - weather  
です (desu) - is  
ね (ne) - isn't it?  
散歩 (sanpo) - walk  
に (ni) - particle indicating direction  
行きましょう (ikimashou) - let's go  
か (ka) - question marker

### Converted Sentence
今日はとてもいい天気ですね、散歩に行きましょうか？

### English Translated Sentence
The weather is very nice today, shall we go for a walk?

### Word by Word Breakdown of the Sentence
今日 (きょう, kyō) - today  
は (wa) - (topic marker)  
とても (totemo) - very  
いい (いい, ii) - good  
天気 (てんき, tenki) - weather  
です (です, desu) - (copula)  
ね (ね, ne) - (sentence ending particle for confirmation)  
、 (、) - (comma)  
散歩 (さんぽ, sanpo) - walk  
に (に, ni) - (direction marker)  
行きましょう (いきましょう, ikimashou) - let's go  
か (か, ka) - (question marker)  
？ (？) - (question mark)
input2_ans:
こんにちは、私は日本語を勉強しています。
Hello, I am studying Japanese.

こんにちは (konnichiwa) - hello
私 (watashi) - I
は (wa) - topic marker
日本語 (nihongo) - Japanese
を (o) - object marker
勉強 (benkyou) - study
しています (shiteimasu) - am doing (continuing form)

### Converted Sentence
こんにちは、私は日本語を勉強しています。

### English Translated Sentence
Hello, I am studying Japanese.

### Word by Word Breakdown of the Sentence
こんにちは - Konnichiwa - Hello  
私は - watashi wa - I (topic marker)  
日本語 - nihongo - Japanese (language)  
を - o - (object marker)  
勉強 - benkyou - study  
しています - shiteimasu - am doing
